intro: Juno sieheana, commonly known as the Sierra Juniper, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to the western United States. It typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to harsh, dry conditions. The plant has small, scale-like leaves that are arranged in whorls around the stem. Its cones are small and often remain closed for many years before releasing seeds. Juno sieheana plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for wildlife in its native range.
